step1.sentence: She reminded herself that no pain no gain as she pushed through the final miles of her marathon training.

step2.story: Every morning, Jake dragged himself to the gym before sunrise, muscles aching from the previous day's workout. His trainer always said, "No pain no gain," and Jake was starting to believe it. Three months later, he ran his first 5K without stopping.

step3.story: Mia had been practicing the piano for eight years, but the final piece for her recital felt impossibly difficult. Her fingers fumbled over the same passage every time, and she wanted to give up. Her teacher sat beside her and said quietly, "No pain no gain — the pieces that challenge you most are the ones that make you grow." Mia took a deep breath and started the passage again, slowly this time. Night after night she practiced until the notes finally flowed without hesitation. When she performed it on stage, the audience applauded longer than she had ever heard before.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 고통이 없으면 얻는 것도 없다는 뜻으로, 노력 없이는 성과도 없음을 직접적으로 표현한 말이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 운동, 공부, 일 등 힘든 과정을 견뎌야 원하는 결과를 얻을 수 있다고 격려하거나 스스로를 다독일 때 사용한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 18세기 벤저민 프랭클린의 글에서 유래한 표현으로, 19세기 이후 운동 문화와 함께 널리 퍼졌다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 다소 진부하게 들릴 수 있지만, 어려운 상황에서 자신이나 타인을 격려하는 긍정적인 맥락에서 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: You have to practice every day — no pain no gain.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 매일 연습해야 해 — 고통 없이는 얻는 것도 없으니까.
